title: World's Largest Offshore Wind Farm Goes Online in UK
introText: The Dogger Bank wind farm in the North Sea has begun generating power, becoming the world's largest offshore wind installation. At full capacity, it will power 6 million British homes with clean electricity.

content.content: Dogger Bank features 277 turbines, each standing 260 meters tall with 107-meter blades. Total capacity of 3.6 gigawatts makes it the largest offshore wind installation ever constructed.
The project will generate enough electricity for 6 million homes, roughly 5% of UK demand. It displaces approximately 4 million tons of CO2 annually compared to gas generation.
Construction created 10,000 jobs in northeast England. Operational jobs and supply chain opportunities will continue for the project's 25-year lifespan.

summary: Dogger Bank becomes the world’s largest offshore wind farm, powering 6M homes with 3.6GW while cutting 4M tons of CO₂ annually.
